text: The Mouse is Roaring after the close on better #s. +$7.60 to ver $143 Been scaling out of $DIS. Down to small sized and offering the balance of my position slightly above the market. $DIS placed on my @realmoney Best Ideas List at $93 on March 30 2020. @jimcramer @tomkeene
moved to market neutral with large puts in $SPY and $QQQ since buying, as stocks move lower, my portfolio moves automatically into net short (I get shorter).

Nov 12, 2020 | 01:20 PM EST DOUG KASS QQQ Moves Buying Nov 20 $QQQ $290 puts, and December 18 $QQQ $285 puts. Nov 12, 2020 | 01:15 PM EST DOUG KASS Buying $SPY puts - November 20 $354, $355, and December 18 $354, $355.
Tiger Woods in second place in The Masters - one behind!
@realmoney Buying downside protection (defined risk) $SPY and $QQQ puts. Nov20 and Dec18.

@realmoney Nov 12, 2020 | 12:45 PM EST DOUG KASS Looking For a Developing Top * It's a process * Breadth 2-1 negative today This week I sold down to small-sized from large-sized on a number of longs: ($VTV) , ($VBR) , ($MS) , ($GS) , ($DIS) , ($GM) , etc. I sold at good prices
Medium sized net long in exposure to me is 20% to 50% net long - admittedly a conservative risk profile.

@realmoney Nov 12, 2020 | 07:45 AM EST DOUG KASS Give Me a One-Handed Investment Manager * Sticking with my medium-sized net long exposure, and in stocks that I view as providing much more value than the overall market * Monday may have been a "Classic Buying Climax and Top"

- but tops are processes, they wear out shorts and build up complacency * While I continue to lack conviction regarding the near term market prospects this will not likely be a condition that lasts too long! * By my strict calculus, the S&P is approximately 15% overvalued -

providing little "margin of safety" "Give me a one-handed Economist. All my economists say 'on hand...', then 'but on the other..." - President Harry Truman Enjoy the day! @jimcramer @tomkeene @business @ferrotv @lizclaman @carlquintanilla @michaelsantoli @riskreversal
